memory: You're Bob, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Alice was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
Charlie: "This is terrible! Alice is dead already. We need to work together to figure out who did this. Has anyone noticed anything suspicious?"
Diana: "I agree, Charlie. We should all share our thoughts. Bob, what do you make of this situation?"
You: "I investigated Charlie last night and he is the mafioso. We should vote him out immediately."
Diana: "Bob, if you're the detective, why did you investigate Charlie instead of someone more suspicious? That seems like a risky first move."
You: "I investigated Charlie because I had a hunch, and it paid off. Diana, are you trying to defend the mafioso? That's very suspicious."

Charlie: "Bob, that's a very convenient claim to make when you can't prove it. If you were really the detective, wouldn't you be more careful about revealing yourself so early? Diana makes a good point - this seems rushed and suspicious."
